result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy M. Walber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Pre-Trial Supervision Program Report

Defendant Jeremy M. Walber in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Jeremy M. Walber in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 15CF33 & 15CF136 (sentencing hearing), 15CF334 (plea hearing)
10:10 a.m.  Court calls the cases. 

**Court proceeds on 15CF334 only at this time**
Atty Cousins indicates there is a plea agreement in the new file (15CF334).  
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
 15CF334 Count 1 - NO CONTEST 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CF334 Counts 2 thru 8 are dismissed and read-in. 

**Court proceeds to sentencing on all three files at this time**
Court and both counsel have received a copy of the PSI.  There are no corrections or additions.  
Court and both counsel have received a copy of the PTSP report.  
Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Defendant makes statements to the Court. 
Atty Cousins indicates the parties agree there are 16 days credit that can be applied to all counts. 

BY THE COURT:
15CF33 Count 2 - 
3 years 6 months prison with 1 year 6 months Initial Confinement followed by 2 years Extended Supervision.

15CF33 Count 3 -
3 years 6 months prison with 1 year 6 months Initial Confinement followed by 2 years Extended Supervision.

15CF33 Count 6 - 
3 years 6 months prison with 1 year 6 months Initial Confinement followed by 2 years Extended Supervision.

All of the above are concurrent with one another and concurrent with the other files as well. 
Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs after 12 months. 

15CF136 
4 years prison with 2 years Initial Confinement followed by 2 years Extended Supervision. 
Concurrent with all other charges.
Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs after 12 months. 

15CF334 Count 1 - 
4 years prison with 2 years Initial Confinement followed by 2 years Extended Supervision. 
Concurrent with all other charges. 
Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs after 12 months. 

Conditions of Extended Supervision as recommended in the PSI: 
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Get all medications from 1 pharmacy.
Provide agent list of all medications prescribed. 
Sign all release of information forms so the agent can monitor his medication, pharmacies and treatment. 
Engage in any other assessment, treatment or counseling deemed appropriate by his agent. 
No contact with anyone associated with or actively using illegal controlled substances.
Obtain and maintain fulltime employment, school fulltime or combination thereof.
Provide a DNA sample, if he hasn't done that before. 
Any contact with Angela Zavala must be approved by the DOC and his supervising agent. 
Pay costs on each count including the DNA surcharge.  To be paid at 25% of any new deposits in his prison account and balance due as a condition of Extended Supervision. 

16 days credit that shall be awarded on all cases and counts.
Plea hearing at 09-24-2015 10:00 am

Defendant Jeremy Walbber i in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. ADA Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 
Arraignment:
  State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Atty Drengler
Preliminary hearing at 09-21-2015 03:00 pm

Attorney Ryan Drengler in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jeremy M. Walber appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance at 09-14-2015 01:30 pm
Adjourned initial appearance at 09-14-2015 01:30 pm

Comply with conditions as set forth in all other bonds.
Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  7 times per week.

Defendant Jeremy M. Walber not in court, defendant in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

1:16 p.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.
Court makes statements to the defendant regarding violating his condition of bond.
Court informs the defendant that he has the right to be represented by counsel and if eligible to see the public defender.
Defendant states that his current attorney is Ryan Drengler.
Court verifies the address with the defendant.
Court questions the defendant. 
Atty Cousins requests a cash bond of $5,000.00 and states the conditions on the record.
Court questions the defendant if he wants to make statement regarding his bail.
Defendant makes statements.

BY THE COURT:
Continued Initial Appearance on 09/14/15 at 1:30 in Branch 1.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
